channel.title: Why is my family pc so slow
channel.description:
It's pretty much laggy with one rs window open and a browser page, cant watch youtube at same time because it laggs
[img]http://i55.tinypic.com/14ecr55.jpg[/img]
As you can see it's 100% how would a duel core differ from this, let's say it was duel 1.8ghz how would that be faster? would it use both cores?
What does "commit charge" mean?

item.title: Why is my family pc so slow
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

c|p:

See, if you would just install Kubuntu this wouldn’t be a problem. I’ve been using it for years and nothing beats it. KDE is just simply way better looking than any other OS I’ve seen, and because Kubuntu is Linux you know it’s the best bang for your buck (or for any buck!)

Seems I no longer have to post anymore? Thanks Cheese Police! haha

item.title: Why is my family pc so slow
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:6, topic:362266”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=458553.msg3355539#msg3355539 date=1285797546]

run 32-bit firefox

I would be impressed if he was running 64 bit firefox on a 32 bit system.
[/quote]oh rofl he only has one core[/quote]
what

[quote=“cumescape, post:7, topic:362266”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=458553.msg3355513#msg3355513 date=1285796283]
Try chrome instead of firefox.
[/quote]Yes install the browser toolbar! That is all it is… Its a toolbar that has the ability to browse. Google still collects all of the websites you goto, Google still gives you a unique ID and saves everything you goto.[/quote]
shut the fuck up you clueless moron.
